results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Joern Gerdts, Robert Fulton, Roger C. Brown, Barry Corbet, Crystal Productions and Summit Films
results.brief_description: The benefits of the outward bound course, including increased autonomy and knowledge of people, and the psychological kick to be had from danger. Good photography and much use of music. This is not an instructional film.

results.title: Odd jobs
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim
results.brief_description: Two Boy Scouts, intent on earning money by doing odd jobs, stumble upon a spooky old house and its macabre owner. He looks forward to scaring them with his “house of horrors” - but young boys today aren’t so easily frightened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim

results.title: Outrageous fortune
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field, Interscope communications and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A madcap comedy involving a menage a trois and espionage. Two actresses who don’t get along with each other, Sandy (Bette Midler) and Lauren (Shelley Long) find out they are both dating the same man, Michael (Peter Coyote). All hell breaks loose when they discover that Michael is a spy working for a foreign government and that he has implicated them both in his schemes. Cast includes Robert Prosky, John Schuck, George Carlin.

results.title: Dear diary
results.creator_credit: David Shepard, Debra Franco and Copperfield Films
results.brief_description: Companion film to “Am I normal?” Raising issues and answering questions relating to female puberty, in a humorous and entertaining manner. Provides information on body changes, maturation, peer pressure and self-image. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED.

results.title: Outback festivals of Australia
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This award winning film records three of the famous festivals held in the Northern Territory each year. Alice Springs is the venue of camel races and the “Henley-on-Todd”, a boating regatta held in a dry creek-bed. Darwin is infamous for its “Beer Can Regatta”, in which all the sea-going racing craft are made entirely from empty beer cans.

results.title: Out: stories of lesbian and gay youth
results.creator_credit: David Adkin, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film explodes some of the myths that provide the foundation for homophobia. It offers insight into the world of several gay and lesbian youth and looks at the people in their lives, identifying some of the difficulties gay youth face. The film attempts to break the damaging silence surrounding sexual orientation and sexual differences.

results.creator_credit_for_label: David Adkin, Silva Basmajian and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.
